Azure AD Domain Verification

12 Dec 2016 - Joseph Gibs

Azure AD Domain Verification

2016-12-12 15:24:27

Setup domain verification Microsoft wants a @ in the txt record. However, the @ sign just means the dns origin is the same for the domain. So if the msoft request is @.familyhosted.com

And @ isn’t allowed with your registrar and you are trying to authorize internal.familyhosted.com you can just replace the @ with “internal”

The @ is more of a wildcard meant to make the process easer and doesn’t require more work on msofts side. Internal.familyhosted.com

**Windows **Check GPOs and ensure WMI has trust groups with right ip subnets as trusted hosts

Enable remote disk mgmt

Enable-Netfirewall
Sc start vds
